modules.description: This module sends HTTP/1.1 requests over a Unix file descriptor and processes responses using provided handlers. It operates on raw connections and structured request/response types, handling message framing and state transitions. Use it to implement custom HTTP clients with precise control over network I/O and message parsing.

This module provides a function to create a connection handler for HTTP/1 servers using Lwt and Unix sockets. It accepts configuration options, request and error handlers, and an optional upgrade handler to manage incoming connections. It works with Unix socket addresses and file descriptors, handling HTTP requests and upgrades like WebSocket.

This module implements HTTP/1 server and client functionality over Unix sockets using Lwt for asynchronous I/O. The Server module creates connection handlers that process HTTP requests and support protocol upgrades, working with Unix socket addresses and file descriptors. The Client module sends HTTP/1.1 requests and processes responses over raw connections, managing message framing and state transitions for custom client implementations.
